meanings.definition: The quality or state of being born
meanings.sent1: The natalities of the puppies brought joy to the family.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the natalities of the newborn babies in the hospital.
meanings.sent3: The natalities of the flowers in the garden seemed to happen overnight!
meanings.sent4: The natalities of ideas in her mind were endless and creative.
meanings.sent5: The natalities of stars in the night sky were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The number of births in a specific population or group
meanings.sent1: The natalities in the village increased significantly this year.
meanings.sent2: The government keeps track of the natalities to plan for the future.
meanings.sent3: The natalities in the zoo made the animals excited for new friends.
meanings.sent4: The natalities of books in the library seemed to multiply magically.
meanings.sent5: The natalities of balloons at the party filled the room with color.
